content:
l be worse off also (Feinberg, 1986, p. 271).
These moves only stave off the difficulties with the pro-choice view; they
do not resolve them. Consider Kant’s account of our obligations to animals.
Kantians certainly know the difference between persons and animals. There-
fore, no true Kantian would treat persons as she would treat animals. Thus,
Kant’s defense of our duties to animals fails to show that Kantians have a
duty not to be cruel to animals. Consider Feinberg’s attempt to show that in-
